“Why do you care about his conscience?”  
“Simply from humanity.”  
“Then he will suffer for his mistake.”  
“But what of the real geniuses? Shouldn’t they suffer too?”  
“Why the word ought? Pain is inevitable for great men.”  
Porfiry smiled and took his cap.  
“Allow me one little question,” he said.  
Raskolnikov stood pale and grave.  
“Very good, tell me your little notion.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The conversation explores the relationship between crime, conscience, and the inevitable suffering of those who commit acts of violence, particularly focusing on the moral implications for "great men."
